subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Sikhism: The Youngest Major Religion
description: A quick, practical guide to Sikhism: The Youngest Major Religion.

hook.text: Founded just 500 years ago, Sikhism has 30 million followers, its own holy book, and a tradition of warrior saints.

buildup.text: Guru Nanak (1469-1539) founded Sikhism in Punjab, India. He rejected caste, idolatry, and empty ritual.

discovery.text: Sikhs believe in one God, equality of all people, and service to humanity. Every Sikh temple feeds anyone free.

twist.text: The turban and uncut hair are acts of faith and identity. Sikhs are often mistaken for Muslims in the West.

climax.text: Sikhism blends Hindu and Islamic influences while being entirely its own. It proves new religions can still emerge.

punchline.text: One God, total equality, free food for all. Sikhism is faith in action.

quiz.question: What are core Sikh beliefs?
options: One God, equality, and service to humanity
